Directions¬∂

Directions in Miniworldmaker¬∂

Directions are handled exactly as in the Scratch programming language, see Scratch-Wiki.

The default direction is 0¬∞. All tokens are looking ‚Äúup‚Äù

  • 0¬∞ or ‚Äúup‚Äù: up

  • 90¬∞ or ‚Äúright‚Äù: Move right

  • -90¬∞ or ‚Äúleft‚Äù: Move left

  • 180¬∞ or ‚Äúdown‚Äù: Move down

  • ‚Äúforward‚Äù: Current direction

Methods¬∂

point_in_direction¬∂

Sets direction of token:

Token.point_in_direction(direction) ‚Üí int[source]

Token points in given direction.

You can use a integer or a string to describe the direction

Parameters

direction as integer or string (The) ‚Äì

Options

  • 0, ‚Äúup‚Äù - Look up

  • 90, ‚Äúright‚Äù, - Look right

  • -90, ‚Äúleft‚Äù, - Look left

  • -180, 180, ‚Äúdown‚Äù - Look down

Examples

Move in a direction with WASD-Keys

>>> def on_key_down(self, keys):
>>>    if "W" in keys:
>>>      self.direction = "up"
>>>    elif "S" in keys:
>>>      self.direction = "down"
>>>    elif "A" in keys:
>>>      self.direction = "left"
>>>    elif "D" in keys:
>>>      self.direction = "right"
>>>    self.move()

turn_left¬∂

Turns token left by degrees degrees

Token.turn_left(degrees: int = 90) ‚Üí int[source]

Turns actor by degrees degrees left

Options:

  • You can set the value token.is_rotatable = False if you don‚Äôt want the token to be rotated.

Parameters

degrees ‚Äì degrees in left direction

Returns

New direction

turn_right¬∂

Turns token right by degrees degrees

Token.turn_right(degrees: int = 90)[source]

Turns token by degrees degrees right

Options:

  • You can set the value token.is_rotatable = False if you don‚Äôt want the token to be rotated.

Parameters

degrees ‚Äì degrees in left direction

Returns

New direction

flip_x¬∂

Mirrors Actor over x-Axis

Token.flip_x() ‚Üí int[source]

Flips the actor by 180¬∞ degrees

Examples

flip a token.

>>>  def on_sensing_not_on_board(self):
>>>    self.move_back()
>>>    self.flip_x()
